Issues.Title: Javascript changed CSS for button not updating on screen
Issues.Body:
Bug

### Overview of the problem

This is about the Bulma **CSS framework**
I'm using Bulma **version** 0.9.1
My **browser** is: Chrome Version 86.0.4240.111 (Official Build) (x86_64)

### Description

If I change add/remove a CSS class with Javascript for button, class is correctly added/removed, but no change is visible on screen (no refresh?).
If I click on another button (for example), the change gets visible.

### Steps to Reproduce

Click on Button 1 to toggle "is-outlined" class to the button.
Nothing happens to Button1, but class is correctly added to CSS element.
Now click on Button2, Button1 now shows outlined, as stated by the "is-outlined" class, but Button2 stays the same.
If you click again on Button1 now Button2 gets outlined on screen.
Visibility Toggle works OK.

Jquery example
https://jsfiddle.net/wu9qxf0j/4/

Cash JS example
https://jsfiddle.net/aswn3o7f/2/

### Expected behavior

Button should become outlined when clicked.

### Actual behavior

CSS Class is added/removed but there is no change on screen
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Javascript changed CSS for button not updating on screen" (#3166)

Issues.Title: Navbar on navbar-item:focus outline can be partially outside the view
Issues.Body:
### Overview of the problem

This is about the Bulma **CSS framework**
I'm using Bulma **version** [0.9.1] 
My **browser** is: Chrome
I am sure this issue is **not a duplicate** I couldn't find it anywhere in the issues

### Description

When using bulma navbar component and using tab to navigate, when the focus reaches a navbar-item the outline can be displayed outside the view. This happens only if your navbar is not inside a padded area and has no margins. But for a navbar it's ususally the case. 

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Add a bulma navbar without padding / margin 
2. Navigate with tab until a navbar-item get focused
3. You can see the ugly outline 

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1055356/97272663-88f32680-1832-11eb-81e9-5217caa5be89.png)

Please check my stackblitz -> https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-awp5ar

### Expected behavior

I understand the outline is part of the navigator "default" style sheet but it should be taken into account. 
I would expect the outline to be fully visible. 

### Actual behavior

The outline is cut at the top / left / right / or bottom depending where it is placed
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Navbar on navbar-item:focus outline can be partially outside the view" (#3162)

I want to propose the creation of a new variable to set the color of the `card-footer-item`, something like `$card-footer-item-color`. I think this is possible. I checked:

https://github.com/jgthms/bulma/blob/133d47d624426a11b61796eff6435a77f9e3d99b/sass/components/card.sass#L68-L77

And I think I can introduce this new variable, but I prefer to open this issue to discuss it before to open a PR.

At this moment to change the color of the items of the footer I write this code:
```scss
.card-footer-item {
  color: $warning;
}
```

But this can be solved just configuring the variable `$card-footer-color`, so everyone that needs to change just override the variable.

I don't know if this variable doesn't exist for a specific reason or maybe I am forgetting something important to take in account in this case, but my initial impression is that this can be useful. If you agree with me, I could open a PR to propose this change.

I want to use this issue to thanks everyone who contributes to Bulma and specially to @jgthms. I fell in love when I began to use it.
